language.title: Русский (RU)
language.phrase: You may strip BB Code and/or Quotes from the message before checking for the above words/phrases. This allows you to ignore certain portions of the message such as quoted text, spoiler/attachment/image/media tags, and code/php/html blocks.
Conversation group names must be unique
Permissive default last read date privacy policy
Disallow suppressing alerts from conversation started by
Maintain Timestamp on Existing Thread Export Users

Do you wish to notify users by alert whenever they are kicked out of a conversation?
Alert will be sent from the conversation starter (the one performing the 'kick' action).
If this feature is enabled, then a reason for the kick may be included with the alert.
Provide a checkbox, when creating an Auto Response, to exclude people you follow from receiving the auto reply.
Allow auto-respond to reply when a user is invited into a conversation
Allow setting up an auto-respond where the start date is in the past
Select the state messages will be assigned when copied to an existing thread. Messages added to a new thread will not be covered by this option.
Choose the nodes that users can export conversations to as threads.
Limit the number of words/phrases a user may have for checking against the conversation title and first message. Zero (0) = no limit (not recommended).

Do you wish to allow the use of regular expressions when searching the title and first message?
This will apply both here in the ACP and for individual users when setting up their own conversation rules (due to the default values showing up on their filter for the very first time).

Uncheck this box to disable the alerts users get when a new user is invited to their conversations. This being unchecked will trump any user preference setting (even if they opt to get the alerts, this will cause them to not get the alerts). Therefore if you uncheck this box, it is recommend to turn off the preference option.

Do you wish to allow individual members to set their own conversation invite alert preferences?
Setting this to 'No' means no alert (default XenForo behaviour) will be sent out, while 'Yes' means that individual users may select whether to receive an alert whenever someone is invited to one of their existing conversations.
Global feature flag to enable/disable if participant groups are usable
Do you wish to include a last message preview when hovering the conversation title?
Length of the last message preview snippet. 0 for the full bbcode version.

Do you wish to display the last read date of each participant of a conversation? This will show the date the user has last read the conversation with a link to the last message read. This information is located under each user name inside of the participants block of a conversation.
If the usergroup permission is set for creating participant groups, how many groups should each member be allowed to create?
How many conversation prefixes can a member have?

Do you wish to check for conversations, where the recipient(s) was a moderator, to which a reply was never given?
Should a moderator be contacted before X number of days (must be set above) have been reached, the conversation starter will receive an Auto Response as soon as X days have passed. This ensures that conversations directed at moderators do not go un-answered.

When the above cron option is selected, this will limit the auto response to conversations that are younger than X days. This prevents very old conversations (such as ones imported from vBulletin) from receiving an outdated/irrelevant response. Value must be larger than Mod Away Num Days above.

Number of days an Admin or Moderator must be AWOL (absent without leave) before the general Auto Response below will get triggered. Please note that this auto response will only kick in if the moderator in question has not set their own active Auto Response via their Account page (requires user group permission).
To disable this feature, enter a value of Zero (0).

Whenever an Admin or Moderator does not have their Auto Response set up and they have not logged into their account in X number of days (set above), this is the auto response a user will receive when a mod they are trying to contact is not around to respond. {to} and {from} will get filled in for you, so do not change those.
You may use BB code syntax such as [B] or [I]
Replace the above member name or add additional names in this format:
[MOD]name_of_your_moderator[/MOD]

Should an Admin or Moderator be permitted to reply to locked conversations?
This prevents a moderator from having to start a new conversation whenever a member contacts them with a locked conversation.
In the inbox popup, would you like to display the last poster's avatar or that of the conversation starter (as is the default)?
# of days since last message for a conversation to be deleted. (0 = Never Prune)
Double confirm that you want to enable confirmation pruning

Do you want conversation messages to be indexed and searchable? If you don't use ElasticSearch, it's recommended to rebuild your entire search index after changing this option.
Requires Conversation Improvements add-on for conversation search

Do you wish to provide your members with the ability to sticky conversations?
Sticky conversations display first at the top of the conversation list.

On the Conversation List page, do you wish to use the default method of displaying usernames or do you wish to use a modified method which allows users to toggle between text and image (avatars) based usernames?
If the above option is set to 'Modified', then would you like the default view of the conversation participants on the list page to be Usernames (text based) or Avatars (image based)?
Do you wish to notify other recipients by alert whenever a previously left user rejoins a conversation ?
If this option is enabled, users will allow others to see their last read date in a conversation by default. If it is disabled, they must opt-in for their last read date to be seen.
Conversations do not get hard deleted once everyone leaves
Select who can copy a conversation to an existing thread.
If this is enabled, the original conversation can be deleted on export (users still require kick permissions).
Select the users that can maintain timestamps when copying conversation messages to a thread.
Options for the Conversation Essentials add-on.
[ConvEss] Inbox Size (max number of messages). Zero (0) = unlimited
[ConvEss] Inbox Size (max number of conversations). Zero (0) = unlimited
[ConvEss] Can kick participants from own conversations
Adds unread-counters to the inbox & label lists

You have been kicked from {name}'s conversation.
Conversation title was '{title}'

{name} has tried to start a conversation with you.
However, since your inbox is full, the conversation was blocked.
Show your Last Read Date of conversation messages
This will permit conversation participants to see the last date, and thus the last message, you have read in a conversation.
Any / All of the following selected rules must be met in order for this rule to match
Are you sure you want to copy this conversation to a thread?
Conversation starter must be older than this age. Leave empty to disable.
Conversation starter must be younger than this age. Leave empty to disable.
Do not auto respond to conversation messages sent by people you follow.
End date must be after the start date
Apply to all received conversations that are currently in your Inbox
First message contains any of these phrases

Place each word or phrase on separate lines. {phraseLimit} Enter the words or phrases to check against the conversation's first message. The conversation's first message must contain any of these phrases. You may use a * as a wild card to match any words (example: Pop* will match both Pop and Popping). Leave empty to disable.
Hide recipients who have left this conversation
Kicks all users from the conversation and deletes it after exporting
Prevent conversation starter from unlocking the conversation.
No groups have been created yet.
No labels have been created yet.
No rules have been created yet.
You may insert up to {limit} words or phrases.
Please choose a valid CSS class.
Please confirm that you want to kick the following recipients
Please confirm that you want to delete the following group
Please confirm that you want to delete the following label
Please confirm that you want to delete the following rule
Please confirm that you want to rejoin the following conversation
Please enter a valid end date for auto response.
Please enter a valid start date for auto response.
The requested conversation label could not be found.
Conversation Rules allow you to redirect newly received conversations into various labelled tab on your conversation list page.
If selected, the conversation starter's gender must match any of these.
Sender has been a member for less than X days
Conversation starter must be registered for fewer than X days. Leave empty to disable.
Sender's post count is less than
Conversation starter must have fewer than X posts. Leave empty to disable.
Show recipients who have left this conversation
Start date must be set in the future

You may strip BB Code and/or Quotes from the message before checking for the above words/phrases. This allows you to ignore certain portions of the message such as quoted text, spoiler/attachment/image/media tags, and code/php/html blocks.
The following recipients have reached their maximum allowed inbox limit: {names}.
The following users were invited to your conversation {title}:
This will allow you to change the way conversation list will appear.
Collaborative: Created as normal, but with the message owners being added as thread collaborators
Collaborative (disabled): Created as normal, but with the message owners being added as thread collaborators (Requires the Collaborative Threads add-on)
Moderated: The thread is placed in the approval queue
If thread title is left empty then this conversation title will be used for the thread title.
Title contains any of these phrases
You do not have permission to kick a adminstrator.
You do not have permission to kick a moderator.
You have reached the limit ({limit}) for conversations.
You have reached the limit ({limit}) for conversation messages.
You've used {percentage}% ({usage}) of {total} total allowed conversation messages.
You've used {percentage}% ({usage}) of {total} total allowed conversations.
Are you sure you want to apply the label specified below to the {count} selected conversations?
